title: Spack not looking in correct PATH when multiple PATHs used in modulefile
body:
When pointing Spack to a modulefile that includes multiple instances of `PATH`, the behavior of Spack appears to be to stop at the first instance of `PATH`. This can lead to errors when using Spack to install packages that depend on this modulefile.

Example modulefile contents:

```
/usr/common/software/modulefiles/python/2.7-anaconda-5.2:

conflict	 python 
module-whatis	 Python programming language.
unsetenv	 PYTHONSTARTUP 
setenv		 PYTHONUSERBASE /global/homes/r/rowlandk/.local/cori/2.7-anaconda-5.2 
prepend-path	 PATH /global/common/cori/software/python/2.7-anaconda-5.2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mpi4py/bin
prepend-path	 PATH /global/common/cori/software/python/2.7-anaconda-5.2/bin 
```
With this, performing a Spack installation with the Python module as a dependency gives:

```
==> Error: RuntimeError: Unable to locate python command in /global/common/cori/software/python/2.7-anaconda-5.2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mpi4py/bin
```

The second instance of `PATH` in the modulefile is what ends up at the beginning of the user's `PATH` upon loading the module, but the way that Spack reads in the modulefile and takes the first instance of `PATH` leads to this erroneous behavior.

---

We have worked around this issue by changing relevant modulefiles, but I would think that Spack's behavior should read all of the `PATH` in the order resultant from loading the module.
